snippet: Prime Minister Lucas Papademos’s fragile coalition was plunged into turmoil as European leaders expressed doubts about Greece’s commitment to achieving solvency.
abstract: Greek Prime Min Lucas Papademos tells lawmakers they must approve new austerity measures demanded by the country's creditors or Greece will suffer a disorderly default; Papademos's comments kick off what is expected to be a long and chaotic weekend of brinkmanship.

byline.original: By NIKI KITSANTONIS and RACHEL DONADIO
byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis reported from Athens, and Rachel Donadio from Rome. Stephen Castle contributed reporting from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Lucas Papademos’s fragile coalition was plunged into turmoil as European leaders expressed doubts about Greece’s commitment to achieving solvency.

headline.seo: Disgruntled Greeks Protest New Austerity Measures
headline.main: As Europe Seeks More, Divisions Rise in Greece Over New Austerity Plan
headline.print_headline: As Europe Seeks More, Divisions Rise in Greece Over New Austerity Plan
